original: LIND, Sven Gustaf, Direktör, Södertälje, f Sthlm 18/2 01 av ing C G L o Jenny Scher-quist, gm Inga Grönwall. Studex S Latin 19, civ.ing KTH (kem) 25. Anst AB Elektrometall 27—28, driftch AB Arbit, Arb, 28—36, vkst dir 36—37, vkst dir o styr.led AB Arb mek verkst 37—43, vkst dir AB W Dan Bergman, Södt, fr 44. Stdflm sed. 34, v. ordf be-redn.utsk, styr.ordf Arb yrkessk, kommis Arb-utställn 35, ordf luftsk.nmdn, luftsk.frns vkst utsk samt hembygdsfrn Arb Minne. Styr.led AB Berglöfs verkstad, Kopparb, Mekanfrbs gjut.sekt, led öbr o Västml l hdlskamm :s vkst utsk. Resor: Koomm.koll stip Tyskl 27, Belg, Norge, Danm, Finl, Tyskl uppr ggr. Av trycket: Art i Tekn Tidskr. Odd Fellow, Sv tekn. -frn. Tekn frn mfl, ordf Ärter o fläsk-klubben Sthlm. Hobbies: Fiske, trädg.skötsel. Se även LINDH. °LINBAHL, Curt Axel Robert, Bankdirektör, Stockholm, f Kkrona 22/12 92 av bkdir I L o Elin Carlson. Studex 10, Upps univ 10—13. Anst Stat Hdlskomm 16, Sv Lantmännens Bk 18, Jordbr.bkn sed. 23, vkst dir där sed. 36. Styr.led AB Lånekassan af 1914, Fastigh.AB Agraria, Fastigh.AB Villahem. RNO.
translated:
LIND, Sven Gustaf, Director, Södertälje, b. Stockholm 18/2 01, son of engineer C G L and Jenny Scherquist, m. Inga Grönwall. Graduated from S Latin School in 1919, graduated as a civil engineer from the Royal Institute of Technology (chemistry) in 1925. Employed at AB Elektrometall from 1927 to 1928, then at AB Arbit as a department manager from 1928 to 1936, promoted to vice director from 1936 to 1937, and vice director and board member at AB Arb Mek Verkstad from 1937 to 1943. Vice director at AB W Dan Bergman in Södertälje since 1944. Member of the Stockholm city council since 1934, vice chairman of the preparatory committee, chairman of the board of Arbetsyrkesskolan, committee member of the Labor Exhibition in 1935, chairman of the aviation school committee, member of the aviation school expansion committee, and chairman of the local heritage association Arb Minne. Board member of AB Berglöfs Verkstad, Kopparberg, the Mechanical Industry Trade Association Casting Section, and a member of the Örebro and Västmanland Chamber of Commerce's growth committee. Travelled to Germany on the Commerce Inspectorate scholarship in 1927, visited Belgium, Norway, Denmark, Finland, and Germany several times. Published articles in Teknisk Tidskrift. Member of the Odd Fellow lodge, Swedish Technological Association, Technological Association for Women, chairman of the Pea and Pork Club in Stockholm. Hobbies: Fishing, gardening. See also LINDH.

LINBAHL, Curt Axel Robert, Bank Director, Stockholm, b. Karlskrona 22/12 92, son of bank director I L and Elin Carlson. Graduated in 1910, attended Uppsala University from 1910 to 1913. Employed at the Commercial Inspectorate in 1916, Swedish Farmers' Bank in 1918, and the Agricultural Bank from 1923, promoted to vice director in 1936. Board member of AB Lånekassan af 1914, Fastighets AB Agraria, Fastighets AB Villahem. RNO...
